info.description: The ctrlX CORE -Logbook API enables you to browse through recoreded diagnostics messages, traces and system messages stored on the ctrlX CORE devices. It enables you to confiure remote logging targets, such as a syslog server, and to access specific diagnostics messages in different languages.
info.title: ctrlX CORE - Logbook API

servers.description: Access the logbook api with relative path
Access the logbook api by specifying a host address

tags.description: gives you access to recorded diagnostics messages, traces and system messages
tags.name: Logbook

tags.description: Groups all operations on remote logging
tags.name: Remote Logging

tags.description: Access to diagnostics messages in different languages
tags.name: Diagnostics Database

get.description: Returns a list of selected logbook entries. You can filter the result by loglevel, unit, entity, messageType or a specified time range. You can also search for specific texts in fields. This operation allows pagination based on the message cursor returned by a previously excuted request.

parameters.description: If specified only log entries with matching loglevel(s) are returned
parameters.name: loglevel

parameters.description: If specified only log entries with matching unit name(s) are returned
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: If specified only log entries with matching entity are returned
parameters.name: entity

parameters.description: Maximum number of elements per page.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The start date for the timespan in which entries are returned. If not specified, oldest available log entries are returned.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: The end date for the timespan in which entries are returned. If omitted, 'now' is used for end_date
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Defines the field names, that should be filled in logEntry. If used with 'searchText', then text is searched in 'fields'
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: If search_text contains a non-empty string, then only messages matching search_text are returned
parameters.name: search_text

parameters.description: If specified, only log entries with matching message type(s) are returned. Accepted values can be retrieved from 'messageTypes'.
parameters.name: messageType

parameters.description: Start position for log entries
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Search direction. Must be used together with cursor. If reverse=false (default), then logbook iterates backwards in time.
parameters.name: reverse

parameters.description: Start position for log entries
parameters.name: timestamp

204.description: The query yields an empty result

401.description: Not authorized to access this resource

500.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

entity.description: If specified only log entries with matching entity are returned
entity.name: entity

start_date.description: The start date for the timespan in which entries are returned. If not specified, oldest available log entries are returned.
start_date.name: start_date

end_date.description: The end date for the timespan in which entries are returned. If omitted, 'now' is used for end_date
end_date.name: end_date

limit.name: limit

reverse.description: Search direction. Must be used together with cursor. If reverse=false (default), then logbook iterates backwards in time.
reverse.name: reverse

messageType.description: If specified, only log entries with matching message type(s) are returned. Accepted values can be retrieved from 'messageTypes'.
messageType.name: messageType

filter.description: JSON object containing the query definition. $or, $and an $in are supported for logical operations.

two_fields.summary: Filter for two fields combinded with an 'and' operator

one_of.summary: Filter for any of a set of values

or_operation.summary: Filter for two fields combined with an 'or' operator

nested_operation.summary: Filter for three fields using both an 'and' and an 'or' operator

filter.name: filter

field.description: Name of message field. Returns all available values for this message field.
field.name: field

withDetailDiagnostics.description: Selects if detail diagnostics are requested
withDetailDiagnostics.name: withDetailDiagnostics

schema.description: Main diagnostics code of requested diagnostics text
Details diagnostics code of requested diagnostics text

fields.description: Defines the field names, that should be filled in logEntry. If used with 'searchText', then text is searched in 'fields'
fields.name: fields

Unauthorized.description: Not authorized to access this resource

BadRequest.description: The request is incomplete or malformed

InternalServerError.description: Something unexpected happened on the server

NoContents.description: The query yields an empty result

persistence.description: Sets if the logbook is stored temporary or persistent on the device. Using persistent mode might increase degeneration of the emmc chip on the device.

timestamp.description: Timestamp reflects the timestamp that was applied to a log entry by the journal when receiving the entry. It is subsequent or identical to SourceTimestamp. (field '__REALTIME_TIMESTAMP')

sourceTimestamp.description: SourceTimestamp reflects the timestamp that was applied to a log entry by the data source. It is prior or identical to timestamp. (field 'R_TIMESTAMP')

userId.description: Unique user id related to user who set the entry (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

mainDiagnosisCode.description: The diagnostics Code of the entry (field 'R_DIAG_MAIN')

mainTitle.description: The main title of the entry (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

detailedTitle.description: The detailed title of the entry (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

dynamicSourceOrigin.description: Name of the application (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

dynamicSourceUnitname.description: Name of the bundle / component / function unit of the application (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

dynamicSourceFilename.description: Name of the file where the log was sent (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

dynamicSourceFunctionname.description: Function name where the log was sent (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

dynamicSourceLinenumber.description: Line number where the log was sent (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

dynamicDescription.description: The dynamic description of the message (parsed from field 'MESSAGE')

messageType.description: The type of message (diag or trace) (field 'R_ENTRY_TYPE')

Problem.description: This document defines a "problem detail" as a way  to carry machine-readable details of errors in a  HTTP response to avoid the need to define new error  response formats for HTTP APIs.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. 
This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, 
it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type 
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member 
is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. 
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, 
except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content 
negotiation; see [RFC7231], Section 3.4).
title.example: You do not have enough credit.

status.description:
The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the 
origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.
It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

code.description:
An error code issued by the system that caused the original problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause of the error.

mainDiagnosisCode.description:
The main diagnosis code is issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the root cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

detailedDiagnosisCode.description:
The detailed diagnosis code issued by the system that caused the problem.
This code can be used to track down the detailed cause and source of the error.
It can be used to search in the documentation for a solution.
The detailed diagnosis code gives additional information about the cause of the error.
It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the same problem.

dynamicDescription.description:
A dynamic description gives detailed information about the occurrence of a problem.
It can change between different occurrences of the same error.

severity.description: Severity of a problem as defined RFC5424 of the Syslog standard, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5424

links.description:
Collection of links to fix the problem. E.g. links to online user manual,
to an online community (using tags) or a developer chat (e.g. Slack).

url.description: URL of syslog server. Currently tcp (e.g. tcp://192.168.0.1:658) and udp (e.g. udp://192.168.0.1:765) are supported.

tag.description: With the tag the log source can be identified in the syslog server

messageFramer.description: RFC5425 prepends the message length to the front of the provided message, as defined in RFC 5425.

connected.description: Connection status of configuration. UDP based configurations have the connection status "unknown".

name.description: A Human-readable identifier of the filter.

facilities.description: Facility/facilities the remote message originates from, e.g. kernel or user.

loglevels.description: Loglevel(s) of the remote log message, e.g. "emergency" or "alert". Corresponds to the severity field of syslogng.

programs.description: Unix-specific application(s) the remote log message originates from, e.g. "sshd" or "systemd-login".

units.description: Specific unit(s) the log message originates from, e.g. "web.identitymanager" or "web.licensemanager", "nodered"

messageTypes.description: Specific message type(s), e.g. trace or diagnosis.

certificate.description: File name of the client certificate used for the TLS connection. The certificate needs to be available as own certificate of "Network Security" in the certificate manager.

key.description: File name of the private key used for the TLS connection. The key needs to be available as own key of "Network Security" in the certificate manager.

ca.description: The name of a file that contains a set of trusted CA certificates used to validate the server certificate for the TLS connection. The certificates need to be available as ca certificates of "Network Security" in the certificate manager.

skipServerCertificateVerification.description: If true, skip server certificate verification. If false, the server certificate will be validated against the specified ca stored in the certificate manager as ca certificate of "Network Security".

MainDiagnostic.description: Diagnostics texts for a given main code

text.description: Translated text for main diagnostics code

detailDiagnostics.description: Collection of detail diagnostics codes and the according translated text
